Issues.Title: [Accessibility][HC] The color of the inverted triangle symbol of "Details" button in Properties window is incorrect when non-selecting it
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK 7.0.100-rc.2.22417.1

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it's not a regression issue, also repro on .NET 6.0.

### Issue description

**Current Behavior:**
The inverted triangle symbol of "Details" button is invisible when non-selecting it.
![issue36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94418985/185284204-c3b648c8-0e4e-4b5e-a7e4-177366875041.png)

**Expected Behavior:**
The inverted triangle symbol of "Details" button should be visible when non-selecting it.
![issue36-expectr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94418985/185284218-771cc459-932d-42dd-89c2-5f96fc6097c1.png)
**More Info:**
1. This issue is repro on theme is HC1/2/Black.
2. This issue is not repro on theme White.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET core project
2. Change the Form's Name properties to ";"
3. Now "Properties Window" will pop up
4. Observe the inverted triangle symbol of "Details" button
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility][HC] The color of the inverted triangle symbol of "Details" button in Properties window is incorrect when non-selecting it" (#7608)

Issues.Title: A11y_VS IDE (DougAm) Individual R&D Subscript_Authentication Mode_ScreenReader:When using the arrow keys to change the selection in the Authentication Mode combo box, screen reader is not announcing the change of selection.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET Framework Version 4.7.2
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2
Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2022 (64-bit) - Int Preview
Version 17.4.0 Preview 2.0 [32815.475.main]


### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

**GitHubTags:**#A11yMAS;#A11yTCS;#BM_VS IDE (DougAm) Individual R&D SubscriptionContainer_Win32_Jul2022;#VS IDE (DougAm) Individual R&D SubscriptionContainer;#Win32;#FTP;#DesktopApp;#A11ySev3;#AILimited;#WCAG1.3.1;#NVDA;#Jaws;#STP;#Element:Combobox;#Benchmark;#Linked:Bug1576845;#LinkedBug;

## Actual:
When using the arrow keys to change the selection in the Authentication Mode combo box, screen reader is not announcing the change of selection.

**Similar issue not observed in JAWS**
## Expected:
When using the arrow keys to change the selection in the Authentication Mode combo box, screen reader should be announcing the change of selection.
## User Impact:
Screen reader user will not be able to get the change of selection information and might accidentally change the selection of combo box.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Please do not close this bug. This bug should only be closed by TCS, C+AI Accessibility tester after bug verification
2. Open Visual Studio version 17.4.0 preview 1.0
3. Run NVDA
4. Create a new "Windows Forma App (.Net Framework" project 
5. Tab till "Properties" in "Solution Explorer" section and press enter
6. Tab till "Debug" tab item and press enter
7. Tab till "Use remote machine" checkbox and select the checkbox
8. Tab to the Authentication Mode combo box use arrow keys to change the section in the combo box and check if the screen reader is announcing the change in combo box.
![arrow keys bug blank winforms](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86601127/185085907-4f1c17d9-5cd0-41c4-ad50-21ffc7b6c42b.gif)
[VBWinformsNetFrameworkShowcaseBadComboBox.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9358395/VBWinformsNetFrameworkShowcaseBadComboBox.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "A11y_VS IDE (DougAm) Individual R&D Subscript_Authentication Mode_ScreenReader:When using the arrow keys to change the selection in the Authentication Mode combo box, screen reader is not announcing the change of selection." (#7603)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/7.0] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#7607)

Issues.Title: Use Cswin32 LOGFONTW
Issues.Body:
- Remove our definition of `LOGFONTW` and use Cswin32's `LOGFONTW`
- Temporarily add `global using HRESULT = Interop.HRESULT` to resolve ambiguous usings. Cswin32 has `HRESULT` defined and it is currently clashing with our definition of `HRESULT`. This will be addressed in a separate PR.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use Cswin32 LOGFONTW" (#7606)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Update dependencies from dotnet/arcade" (#7604)

Issues.Title: Convert Last of Gdi32 CreateX to Cswin32
Issues.Body:
- Convert `CreateDC`,`CreateEnhMetaFile`,`CreateICW`,`CreatePatternBrush`,`CreateFontIndirect` to Cswin32
- Add implicit conversion `HdcMetdataEnhFileHandle` > `HDC`
- Temporarily added `using LOGFONTW = Windows.Win32.Graphics.Gdi.LOGFONTW` for files with ambiguous `LOGFONTW` reference. Will replace all `LOGFONTW` references to use Cswin32 `LOGFONTW` in next PR

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7596)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Convert Last of Gdi32 CreateX to Cswin32" (#7596)

Issues.Title: Turn Off Safe Handle Friendly Overloads
Issues.Body:
- Updated Cswin32 version
- Removed temporary usage of `GetModuleHandleEx` and replace with `GetModuleHandle`. We used `GetModuleHandleEx` because of the difficulties with the safe handle overload generated by `GetModuleHandle`, but now we have ability to turn off safe handles.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7600)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Turn Off Safe Handle Friendly Overloads" (#7600)

Issues.Title: Still unable to add a used control to Design File and related issues
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Version 17.4.0 Preview 1.0


### .NET version

6

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes under Framework

### Issue description

There does not seem to be a way to add a user control to Toolbox and adding the control manually to Designer File manually works as long as you don't open the designer where parts of it will be deleted. The Symbol will be preserved but most of the initializations will be deleted.

Has an example that works as long as you don't open Form1 in designer. Plus no way to get User Control in ToolBox

https://github.com/paul1956/ToolStripComboBoxExTest


### Steps to reproduce

https://github.com/paul1956/ToolStripComboBoxExTest. Run the program and see the User Control working. Then open Form1 in designer and make any change and the User Control will be deleted.

### Diagnostics

```text
N/A
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Still unable to add a used control to Design File and related issues" (#7602)

Issues.Title: Convert FormatMessageW to CsWin32
Issues.Body:
- Converted `FormatMessageW` to CsWin32
- Deleted Kernel32 folder since it has no more files inisde it

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Narrator is reading ToolStripMenuitems even when they are disabled
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK 7.0.100-rc.1.22416.2


### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it's not a regression issue, also repro on .NET 6.0.

### Issue description

[Accessibility] Narrator is reading ToolStripMenuitems even when they are disabled
![repro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96758262/185018197-a48fdd96-237c-48bb-8aae-c16657fb40c4.gif)



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a .NET Core WinForms project with toolStrip/MenuStrip control added
2. Focus on toolStrip/MenuStrip, add some item, right click an item, unchecked Enabled option
3. Build and Run project, Launch Narrator
4. Used keyboard Tab/Tab control/Left/Right to focus all items
5. Check if the Narrator focus and read disabled items
Or open attached project
[WinFormsApp4.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9355761/WinFormsApp4.zip)

**Current Behaviors:**
Narrator is reading disabled MenuItems
![repro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96758262/185018440-9a22dd86-db82-41ca-a3d0-02b2b1927fd6.png)
![repro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96758262/185018404-40cb63ea-fadd-424f-95da-1788e66a4ad9.gif)

**Expected Behaviors:**
Narrator skips disabled MenuItems
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Narrator is reading ToolStripMenuitems even when they are disabled" (#7601)

Issues.Title: Temporarily fix VB App Framework Logging.
Issues.Body:
The runtime PR https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/73087 broke the Visual Basic Application Framework Logging.

https://source.dot.net/#Microsoft.VisualBasic.Forms/Microsoft/VisualBasic/Logging/Log.vb,170

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9663150/184300141-c5e087f7-e28c-4c5e-a498-e0db369a3884.png)

The original assumption that this would work was, that when `GetSupportedAttributes` gets called in a class derived from `TraceSource` that then would tell that the trace source was configured from a config file. This is not only what `DefaultTraceSource` does, it seems to be the only reason for it existence. Now, as far as I understand it, after the change, `GetSupportAttributes` gets called unconditionally, so `HasBeenConfigured` in the VB AppFramework's `DefaultTraceSource` returns always `true`, and so a FileLogTraceListener gets never added, since the Log class assumes, the trace source was configured by a config file. And that's why there will never be a value other than `nothing` for the `DefaultFileLogWriter` property.

After discussing this with the WinForms Team and the VB PM, we're fixing this temporary in the runtime, by returning `false` unconditionally for `Logging.Log.HasBeenConfigured`. This assumes, that the trace source has NOT been configured by a config file. Configuring by a config file remains a broken scenario for VB My.Logging, until we will be getting a fix from the Runtime.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7590)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Temporarily fix VB App Framework Logging." (#7590)

Issues.Title: Convert Gdi32 GetX to Cswin32
Issues.Body:
- Convert `GetBitmapBits`,`GetBkColor`,`GetBkMode`,`GetBrushOrgEx`,`GetClipBox`,`GetClipRgn`,`GetCurrentObject`,`GetDeviceCaps`,
`GetDIBits`,`GetMapMode`,`GetNearestColor`,`GetObjectType`,`GetRegionData`,`GetRgnBox`,`GetROP2`,`GetStockObject`,
`GetSystemPaletteEntries`,`GetTextAlign`,`GetTextColor`,`GetTextExtentPoint32W`,`GetTextMetrics`,`GetViewportExtEx`,
`GetViewportOrgEx`,`GetWorldTransform`,`StretchDIBits`,`GetObject`,`GetPaletteEntries`,`GetTextExtendPoint32W`
- Move `SelectPaletteScope` to PInvoke folder
- Add `IHandle<HDC>` to `HDC`
- `Control.MetafileDCWrapper.cs`: Change initialization of `BITMAPINFO` used in calls `GetDIBits` and `StretchDIBits`. Cswin32 definition of `BITMAPINFO` contains trailing array thus we now need to manually allocate enough space for the bitmap colors. Also done some re-arrangement of code to try to reduce nesting.

Issues.Title: Complete obsoletion process for DomainUpDownAccessibleObject class.
Issues.Body:
We'll be conservative in NET7 and will return instance of an obsoleted DomainUpDownAccessibleObject type from DomainUpDown.CreateAccessibilityInstance method. This will prevent failures of the runtime casts in snippets like this one:
```
internal class MySpinner : DomainUpDown
{
<snip>
DomainUpDownAccessibleObject ao = CreateAccessibleObject() as DomainUpDownAccessibleObject;
<snip>
}
```

In .NET 8 we will remove protected override methos `DomainUpDown.CreateAccessibilityInstance`. This kind of change is allowed by the [breaking changes](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/coding-guidelines/breaking-change-rules.md#members) rules:
```
Introducing or removing an override

Make note, that introducing an override might cause previous consumers to skip over the override when calling base.
```

Additionally, we should consider promoting build time warning to an error because this class had always been documented as internal use only. Lets discuss this part of the change within the team.

_Originally posted by @Tanya-Solyanik in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7330#discussion_r944772133_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Complete obsoletion process for DomainUpDownAccessibleObject class." (#7587)

Issues.Title: Deprecate `WebBrowser`, `HtmlDocument` and associated types
Issues.Body:
The WebBrowser control is based on IE Trident engine, which is almost universally unusable for general web browsing these days. It is also based on COM/ActiveX, which poses difficulties in trimming/native AOT scenarios.

Also, Internet Explorer 11 has been retired and is officially out of support as of 15 June 2022. Whilst the underlying Trident engine (mshtml.dll)  isn't being removed (yet?) from Windows, the general guidance is to use the modern replacement, which is WebView2 web browser control.

Resolves #6964


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7582)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Deprecate `WebBrowser`, `HtmlDocument` and associated types" (#7582)

Issues.Title: `Form_DpiChanged_MinMaxSizeChanged_WithRuntimeSetting` Fail in CI
Issues.Body:
### Test

`Form_DpiChanged_MinMaxSizeChanged_WithRuntimeSetting` 

### Issue description

`Form_DpiChanged_MinMaxSizeChanged_WithRuntimeSetting` fail only on lab machines and pass on local machines. It seems lab machines failing to set thread's Dpi context. Need to investigate further to confirm theory.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue " `Form_DpiChanged_MinMaxSizeChanged_WithRuntimeSetting` Fail in CI" (#7579)
